name: Mount Garfield

trails_config.name: Garfield Trail
trails_config.description: This straightforward trail climbs gradually on old fire roads, making for one of the easier 4K hikes despite the length. The final short, steep push leads to a rubble-filled summit with the foundations of an old fire tower. From Mount Garfield’s peak, enjoy stunning 360° views, including an incredible perspective down Franconia Ridge and into the Pemigewasset Wilderness.
trails_config.parking_info: Garfield Trailhead, Gale River Loop Rd

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 4500 feet, Mount Garfield offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4500 feet, Mount Garfield is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Garfield Trail**, a **10.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Galehead**, which is just 2.0 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
